intro: Dudleya nubigena, commonly known as the cloud Dudleya, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green with a waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or white during the spring. It thrives in rocky soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Dudleya nubigena is well adapted to dry climates and is often found in coastal regions.
